info.name: Square Diner
info.title: Square Diner
info.blurb: A standalone, nostalgic diner that stands out from the surrounding TriBeCa neighborhood.
info.intro: Square Diner is one of the rare remaining standalone diners in New York, and it sits among a crowd of skyscrapers and warehouses in TriBeCa. I love the atmosphere of standalone diners, it’s like a little isolated experience that's separated from the rest of the city. Square Diner has a lost to prove as so many other standalone diners are closing. It's trying really hard to be memorable and I think sometimes it goes to far, but in the end it's a standalone diner worthy of its little footprint.

not_good: Decoration is too over the top
